pages:
STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
July 8, 2022
Lenier Holston
Kalamazoo County DHHS
427 E Alcott Street
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
RE: License #: CP390201215
Investigation #: 2022C0212013
Kalamazoo County DHHS
Dear Mr. Holston:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP390201215
Investigation #: 2022C0212013
Complaint Receipt Date: 04/29/2022
Investigation Initiation Date: 04/29/2022
Report Due Date: 06/28/2022
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Address: 235 South Grand Avenue
Lansing, MI 48902
Licensee Telephone #: (517) 373-3768
Administrator: Lenier Holston, Administrator
Demetrius Starling, Designee
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling, Designee
Name of Facility: Kalamazoo County DHHS
Facility Address: 427 E Alcott Street
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
Facility Telephone #: (269) 337-5000
Original Issuance Date: 09/10/1993
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 09/25/2020
Expiration Date: 09/24/2022
Capacity: Unknown
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, FIA
1

II. ALLEGATION
Violation
Established?
Employee at agency sent a nude picture of themself to a foster Yes
youth. There are additional concerns that youth has stayed with
this employee at a motel.
III. METHODOLOGY
04/29/2022 Special Investigation Intake
2022C0212013
04/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call made, Obtained additional information
from the source.
04/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call made, Consult with Area Manager
04/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call received, Interview with Chief
Administrator
04/29/2022 Special Investigation Initiated – Telephone, contact with Chief
Administrator
04/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call made, Attempted call to assigned Law
Enforcement Officer
05/04/2022 Contact - Face to Face, Staff interviews completed on-site
05/05/2022 Contact - Document Sent, Received additional information from
Program Manager
05/13/2022 Contact - Document Received, Additional information received
from Program Manager
05/18/2022 Contact - Face to Face, Reviewed investigation via video
conference with DCWL area manager
05/23/2022 Contact - Telephone call made, Foster Care Worker
05/24/2022 Contact - Telephone call made to LE, left a message
06/07/2022 Contact - Telephone call made to LE
06/09/2022 Contact - Document Received. Received email from LE.
Investigation ongoing.
06/17/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email to LE with additional questions.
06/21/2022 Contact - Telephone call made. Attempted call to Youth A; wrong
number.
06/21/2022 Contact - Telephone call made. Attempted call to Youth A’s
mother; number not in service.
06/24/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email to DHHS monitor and Supervisor
to request alternate phone numbers.
06/24/2022 Contact -Telephone call made. Phone call and text to Staff 1. No
answer, no response.
06/28/2022 Contact - Document sent. Email to private agency Program
Manager to request alternate phone number for Youth A.
06/28/2022 Contact - Document Received. Email from private agency PM,
worker is on vacation. Alternate phone number unknown for Youth
A.
2

06/28/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email to Kalamazoo DHHS PM and
Supervisor to request alternate number for Youth A.
06/28/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email to complainant to request
alternate phone number. Complainant deferred to a staff member
at Disability Network.
06/28/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email to Disability Network worker,
requested alternate phone number for Youth A and youth’s
mother.
06/28/2022 Contact - Document Received. Email from Kalamazoo DHHS
provided a phone number that may be for Youth A’s mother,
although unconfirmed.
06/28/2022 Contact - Telephone call made. Attempted phone call with Youth
A’s mother; no answer.
06/28/2022 Contact - Telephone call received. Consulted with DCWL Area
Manager regarding Children’s Services review.
06/29/2022 Contact -Telephone call received. Phone interview with Youth A’s
Mother and attempted interview with Youth A.
06/29/2022 Contact - Telephone call made. Consulted with DCWL Area
Manager.
06/29/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email with Law Enforcement.
07/08/2022 Contact - Document Sent. Email with Youth A.
07/08/2022 Contact -Telephone call made. Pre-exit with Program
Manager/Chief Administrator, with email follow-up.
ALLEGATION:
Employee at agency sent a nude picture of themself to a foster youth. There are
additional concerns that youth has stayed with this employee at a motel.
INVESTIGATION:
On 4/29/22 it was reported to DCWL that Staff 1, a Michigan Youth Opportunities
Initiative (MYOI) case worker sent nude photos to Youth A. Youth A is a person with
a cognitive impairment. It was reported Youth A may have stayed with Staff 1 in a
hotel. However, further details are unknown.
Complainant
On 4/29/22 the complainant was interviewed by phone. The complainant reported
the photos on Youth A’s phone were found by his mother. The complainant reported
observing the photos as provided by Youth A’s mother. They were fully nude photos
of Staff 1. Staff 1’s face could be seen in the photos. It was believed Staff 1 was
Youth A’s MYOI worker. DHHS and Law Enforcement (LE) were contacted and
provided with this information. Complainant reported Youth A’s mother informed her
there was something with Youth A and Staff 1 at a hotel but did not have any further
information.
3

Chief Administrator
On 4/29/22 the Chief Administrator (CA) was contacted via Teams video call. The
CA reported being aware of the allegation and the involvement of LE. CA was
informed that while LE would be investigating any criminal actions, DCWL needed to
investigate to determine if the staff member acted in manner that was inconsistent
with licensing rules and her role as an agency staff. CA reported Staff 1 was placed
on administrative leave. However, they had not been able to reach her by phone or
email.
Law Enforcement
On 4/29/22, 5/4/22, 5/10/22, 5/18/22, and 5/24/22 LE was contacted by phone;
messages were left for the officer. On 6/7/22 LE was contacted via email. A
response was received on 6/9/22, in which LE reported the investigation was
ongoing. LE further reported interviews were completed with Youth A and his
mother. LE stated Staff 1 was refusing to comply with an interview. On 6/17/22,
additional information was requested from LE. On 6/28/22 LE reported the
investigation would be completed and referred to the prosecutor’s office within the
next few weeks.
Foster Care Supervisor
On 5/4/22 an interview was completed at the agency with Foster Care Supervisor
(Supervisor). Supervisor reported Staff 1 was an MYOI coordinator at the agency.
She explained Staff 1’s role was to reach out to youth in foster care and notify them
of programs and training opportunities that are available through MYOI. It was
believed Staff 1 met Youth A through one of these programs. However, Youth A’s
foster care case was managed by another agency.
Supervisor verified Staff 1 was the person in the photos. Supervisor also provided
documentation that Youth A attended MYOI meetings with Staff 1 on the following
dates:
 Virtual meetings in a group setting: 10/5/2021, 10/11/2021, 10/14/2021,
11/16/2021, 11/17/2021, 11/30/2021, 12/2/2021, 12/7/2021, 12/9/2021,
12/21/2021, 1/5/2022 and 1/10/2022.
 Face to face contact between Staff 1 and Youth A: 12/1/2021 and 12/8/2021
Supervisor verified Staff 1 was placed on leave. After initially being unable to contact
her on 4/29/22, Staff 1 arrived at the agency to turn in her computer and phone. The
agency also blocked her access to the MYOI Facebook page. During this interaction,
Staff 1 reported Youth A’s family was trying to extort her for money. Staff 1 reported
there were messages on the MYOI Facebook about it, but the messages were no
longer there. Supervisor reported prior to this, there were no concerns regarding
Staff 1. Staff 1 was always professional and organized. Staff 1 did not have any
disciplinary action and never mentioned Youth A.
4

Program Manager
On 5/4/22 an interview was completed at the agency with Program Manager.
Program Manager reported being aware of the allegation and attempting to have
contact with LE. However, they had not been responsive. Program Manager stated
prior to the allegation, she did not have any concerns about Staff 1 and there was no
disciplinary action on file. Program Manager reported she initially became aware of
this situation as Youth A’s mother was in the DHHS lobby showing the photos and
telling everyone in the lobby about it. Program Manager and Supervisor were not in
the building at the time, but they were informed by other staff. The photos were later
sent to Supervisor’s phone, where Program Manager viewed them. Program
Manager reported the nude photos were of Staff 1. Staff 1’s face was visible in a few
of them. Program Manager also stated the tattoos on the person in the photos
matched those of Staff 1 as posted on her social media. Labor relations and LE were
contacted. Staff 1 came to the building around 5:00pm and turned in her computer
and phone. Program Manager then changed the MYOI Facebook account to prevent
Staff 1 from further accessing any messages. Program Manager reported checking
the account and found all private messages had been deleted. As Youth A’s foster
care case is managed by another office, that office was contacted and informed of
the situation. A welfare check was completed with Youth A by his assigned foster
care worker on 4/29/22. A safety plan was reportedly implemented by the worker, in
which Youth A agreed not to have any contact with Staff 1.
On 5/5/22 Program Manager contacted DCWL by phone and provided contact
information for LE as a new officer had been assigned. On 5/13/22 Program
Manager contacted DCWL by email and reported that she was no longer attempting
to contact LE as Labor Relations had concluded their investigation. Effective
5/11/22, Staff 1 was no longer employed with the agency.
Foster Care Worker
On 5/23/22 phone contact occurred with Youth A’s foster care worker (Worker).
Worker stated she never had contact with Staff 1 as they are with different agencies.
Worker reported never hearing Youth A mention Staff 1, or any photos, or any other
indication of an inappropriate relationship. However, Youth A’s mother sent the nude
photos of Staff 1 to Worker when the allegation was made. Worker reported seeing
Youth A on 4/29/22 for a ‘welfare check’ to make sure he was ok after the
allegations were reported. Worker stated Youth A made a safety plan with his
attorney, not to have any contact with Staff 1. The safety plan also indicated Youth A
would not be alone with any staff at any time. When Worker completed her face-to-
face contact with Youth A on 4/29/22, she had another staff accompany her. Worker
did not have a copy of the attorney’s safety plan.
Youth A’s mother
A phone number listed in MiSACWIS was attempted for Youth A’s mother. However,
the number was out of service. Several attempts were made to obtain contact
information from professionals involved in the family’s case previously. Two
additional phone numbers were obtained. However, attempts to both numbers on
5

6/28/22, went unanswered. On 6/29/22 Youth A’s mother called and completed a
phone interview. She reported Youth A came to her with concern about Staff 1
contacting him frequently and sending him pictures. Youth A indicated he was
annoyed by the constant attention from Staff 1. Youth A provided the nude photos to
his mother. His mother then went to DHHS to speak with Supervisor. However, the
Supervisor was not there. Youth A’s mother then sent the photos to the Supervisor
via text. Youth A’s mother indicated she only knew about the photos from Youth A
and did not have any direct knowledge about a hotel room. Youth A’s mother also
reported that regarding this allegation, a new detective has been assigned, and LE
stated their investigation was ongoing, due to additional victims coming forward.
Youth A’s mother discussed some prior incidents of alleged abuse while Youth A
was previously in a foster home in 2016 or 2017 and a residential facility in 2019. A
review of MISACWIS found the allegations regarding the residential facility were
investigated by DCWL and DHHS in 2019 (SIR 2020C0214007). A review of Youth
A’s placements in 2016/2017 did not find any special evaluations or allegations of
the described sexual abuse toward Youth A in a foster home. Although a review of
Children’s Services history found a DHHS investigation from 2016 that matched the
allegation. This abuse allegedly occurred in 2015/2016 while Youth A was living in
his adoptive home. DHHS completed an investigation, which resulted in Youth A
being removed from the adoptive home and placed in foster care. As both
allegations have been previously investigated, no further action is required at this
time.
Youth A
A phone call was attempted on 6/21/22. The person that answered, reported it was
the wrong number. During a call with Youth A’s mother on 6/29/22, Youth A was on
the line briefly, but declined an interview. An email was sent to Youth A on 7/6/22
requesting an in person or phone interview. On 7/7/22 Youth A responded and
declined an interview, referring DCWL to his attorney.
Law Enforcement
On 6/29/22 emails were exchanged with the assigned officer. LE reported Youth A’s
mother was incorrect, there have been no additional victims identified and no
change in the assigned officer.
Staff 1
A phone call was attempted on 6/24/22, a message was left. A follow-up text was
sent to Staff 1’s personal phone number, requesting that she call or text back, even
if she did not wish to be interviewed. No response was received.
Documents reviewed
 The photos sent to the agency by Youth A’s mother, were reviewed while on-
site on 5/4/22. The photos of Staff 1 were nude and showing her face in some
pictures. In addition, there was a private message from the MYOI Facebook
account in which Staff 1 asked Youth A why he had not been contacting her.
6

Youth A stated he was busy. Staff 1 replied that it seemed like he stopped
messaging her after she showed him what she did. There was no clarification
about what she was referring to.
 Staff 1’s personal social media profile was reviewed and confirmed the photos
sent to Youth A, were of Staff 1. Confirmation occurred by matching Staff 1’s
face and multiple body tattoos.
 A review of Staff 1’s HR file was completed. Staff 1 was hired on 2/2/2009,
new hire and annual training was completed as required, and there was no
disciplinary action on file.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
ANALYSIS: A violation was found as it was determined that Staff 1 provided
nude photos of herself to Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status. The investigation will be re-opened by DCWL if law enforcement
determines any information indicating any additional licensing violation.
_ _______________July 8, 2022__________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 8, 2022
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
7

metadata.agency_name: Michigan Department of Health and Human

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at Kalamazoo County DHHS sent nude photos of herself to a foster youth with a cognitive impairment and had inappropriate contact. The facility was cited for violating staff qualification rules requiring staff to be suitable for their duties. The facility is held responsible for the employee's actions and must submit a corrective action plan.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation involves staff sending nude photos (sexual content) to a foster youth, which falls under sexual abuse, categorized as severe due to safety and violence concerns, including sexual abuse. Additional concerns about the youth staying with the employee at a hotel (implying inappropriate physical contact) further support the severe classification.
